title: ‘Pathetic’ – Graeme Smith slams South Africa over bizarre toss against India
text:
South Africa used as proxy captain for the toss against India (Picture: Star Sport)

South Africa’s decision to use a proxy captain for the coin toss ahead of the third Test against India was ‘pathetic’, according to Graeme Smith.

Proteas captain Faf du Plessis had lost eight straight tosses in Asia before the third Test in Ranchi.

In an attempt to change South Africa’s fortunes, he therefore decided to elect Temba Bavuma as his proxy captain for the toss.

Bavuma called incorrectly, so South Africa lost the toss yet again and India reached 224-3 when bad light forced an early finish to day one.

Rohit Sharma scored a century on day one of the third Test Picture: AP)

Kagiso Rabada took two early wickets, and Anrich Nortje dismissed India skipper Virat Kohli, but Rohit Sharma’s century and 83 from Ajinkya Rahane left the hosts in a strong position.

Asked about his toss, former South Africa captain Smith told Star Sports: ‘It was a quirky moment but for me, it was a little bit pathetic.

‘It just shows the mindset of the South African side. I didn’t enjoy seeing that. I would rather see the South Africa captain stand there, own his position.

Virat Kohli’s side have already won the series (Picture: AP)

‘You know, they are looking at the wrong places for the reasons they have lost the game. Unfortunately, they haven’t played well enough.

‘Yes, winning the toss in the sub-continent is a nice thing to do but if you play well enough, you can still compete.’

India are already 2-0 up in the three-match series.
